explain the offside rule in 20 words or less

The offside rule is a rule in soccer that forbids players from being in the opposing team's half of the field before their goal line without the ball. It is usually enforced to prevent players from gaining an advantage by deliberately passing the ball to themselves, but can also be used to prevent opponents from playing the ball in certain situations.
